tab1.headline: UAE's e-Invoicing Mandate Creates a B2B Payments Opportunity
tab1.subheadline: The UAE e-Invoicing mandate rolls out in two waves starting 2027. It digitizes invoices -- but not payments. For Visa and Mashreq, this gap is greenfield.

statCards.label: Wave 1 -- Large Businesses
statCards.description: Pilot starts Jul 2026 for businesses with revenue >= AED 50M. Mandatory from Jan 2027.

statCards.label: Wave 2 -- SMEs
statCards.description: All remaining businesses (revenue < AED 50M) go live. ASP appointment by Mar 2027.

statCards.label: B2B Coverage
statCards.description: All VAT-registered businesses issuing B2B and B2G invoices must comply

whatItSolves.text: -- structured PINT AE / UBL 2.1 format, auto-validated
-- Peppol network, guaranteed receipt, audit trail

whatItDoesntSolve.headline: The Mandate Solves Invoicing. Not Payments.
whatItDoesntSolve.body: Payment collection remains disconnected. No mechanism to embed payment links, trigger payments, or reconcile invoices with payment status. Manual bank transfers, cheques, 30-90 day DSO.
whatItDoesntSolve.callout: This is the gap Visa and Mashreq fill.

tab1.quoteBanner: "Every e-Invoice carries a Visa payment link. Every payment routes through Visa rails. Every validated invoice feeds Mashreq's financing pipeline."

partnerCards.headline: For Visa
partnerCards.body: Capture SME payment volume at the point of invoice creation. SMEs lack treasury infrastructure -- embedded Visa payment links in every e-Invoice give them a one-click payment path, making Visa the default B2B rail.

partnerCards.headline: For Mashreq
partnerCards.body: Finance against pre-validated, FTA-compliant invoice data. Every invoice passing the platform is schema-validated, de-duplicated, and government-reported -- a pre-qualified lending asset at scale.

sell-erp.title: Invoice Created in ERP
sell-erp.subtitle: The starting point for every Visa B2B transaction
sell-erp.detail: The seller creates an invoice in their ERP or accounting software. This is the origin of every potential Visa payment -- the invoice includes buyer details, line items, quantities, unit prices, VAT calculations, and payment terms. Once submitted, Clear's platform transforms it into a payment-ready e-Invoice.
sell-erp.dataFlow: Seller ERP generates structured invoice data with all fields required per UAE e-Invoicing mandate.

sell-transform.title: Ingest + Transform to PINT AE
sell-transform.subtitle: Structured data enables Visa link embedding
sell-transform.detail: The seller's invoice data is transformed into PINT AE (Peppol International, UAE profile) format -- a UBL 2.1 compliant XML structure. This structured format is what enables Visa payment links and Mashreq financing data to be embedded. Clear's platform handles the transformation via ERP plugin or API, including seller/buyer TRN, line-level tax breakdowns, and all FTA-required fields.
sell-transform.dataFlow: Seller ERP → Clear: Raw invoice data via API/plugin. Clear generates PINT AE XML with FTA-compliant structure.

sell-validate.title: Validation Pipeline
sell-validate.subtitle: Ensures data integrity for Visa and Mashreq
sell-validate.detail: The validation pipeline ensures every invoice that reaches Visa's payment rails and Mashreq's financing platform is accurate and compliant. Steps: (1) XSD schema check, (2) XSLT transformation rules, (3) Business rule validation (tax calculations, mandatory fields), (4) Duplicate detection -- critical for Mashreq's financing risk model, (5) FTA-specific UAE compliance rules. Clear's platform executes this pipeline; any failure rejects the invoice with specific error codes.
sell-validate.dataFlow: Internal pipeline: XSD → XSLT → Business rules → Duplicate check → FTA rules. Sequential validation with fail-fast.

sell-decision.title: Has Payment Link?
sell-decision.subtitle: Ensuring 100% Visa payment link coverage
sell-decision.detail: This decision point ensures 100% Visa payment link coverage -- the key metric for B2B payment capture. If the invoice already contains a valid Visa payment link (from an ERP with direct Visa integration), it is validated and proceeds. If missing, the platform routes to Visa PayFac to generate one. The result: every invoice carries a Visa payment mechanism, maximizing transaction capture.
sell-decision.dataFlow: Platform inspects the invoice's additional document reference field for a valid Visa payment URL. Routes to YES (proceed) or NO (request from PayFac).

sell-visa-req.title: Request Payment Link from Visa PayFac
sell-visa-req.subtitle: Visa generates a payment link for this invoice
sell-visa-req.detail: The Visa PayFac API is called with the invoice amount (AED), seller's merchant ID, and a unique invoice reference. Visa PayFac generates a payment link and QR code that are embedded into the e-Invoice XML. This is the moment a compliance document becomes a Visa payment trigger. Clear orchestrates the API call and embeds the result.
sell-visa-req.dataFlow: Clear → Visa PayFac: Amount, merchant ID, invoice ref. Visa → Clear: Payment link URL + QR data.

sell-proceed.title: Proceed with Existing Link
sell-proceed.subtitle: Visa payment link already embedded upstream
sell-proceed.detail: The seller's ERP already embedded a Visa payment link. The platform validates it's active, correctly formatted, and matches the invoice amount. This path means Visa's payment link was generated upstream -- still captured as a Visa B2B transaction.
sell-proceed.dataFlow: Platform validates existing payment link against invoice metadata. If valid, proceeds to dispatch.

sell-ready.title: Invoice + Embedded Payment Link
sell-ready.subtitle: 100% Visa payment coverage achieved
sell-ready.detail: Whether the link was newly generated or pre-existing, every invoice now carries a validated Visa payment mechanism. This is the central value proposition: 100% of invoices carry an embedded Visa payment option, converting every e-Invoice into potential Visa transaction volume. For Mashreq, each validated invoice is also a pre-qualified financing asset.
sell-ready.dataFlow: Validated PINT AE XML with Visa payment link in additional document reference. Ready for Peppol, FTA, and Mashreq.

sell-peppol.title: Peppol Delivery to Buyer ASP
sell-peppol.subtitle: Every invoice delivered = a Visa payment link delivered
sell-peppol.detail: The e-Invoice -- now carrying a Visa payment link -- is dispatched to the buyer's ASP via Peppol AS4 protocol. From Visa's perspective, this is distribution: every invoice delivered is a payment link delivered. Clear handles the Peppol network delivery with signed SBDH envelopes and full audit trail.
sell-peppol.dataFlow: Clear → Peppol SMP → Buyer ASP (AS4). Buyer ASP → Clear: delivery receipt / MDN.

sell-fta.title: FTA Government Reporting
sell-fta.subtitle: Government validation strengthens Mashreq's financing data
sell-fta.detail: In parallel, invoice data is submitted to FTA for CTC (Continuous Transaction Controls) compliance. This government reporting step legitimizes the invoice data that Mashreq uses for financing decisions -- FTA-validated invoices carry higher confidence for underwriting. Clear handles the FTA API submission; FTA returns a clearance UUID.
sell-fta.dataFlow: Clear → FTA: CTC submission via FTA API. FTA → Clear: Clearance status / UUID.

sell-mashreq.title: Mashreq Financing Submission
sell-mashreq.subtitle: Pre-validated invoices feed Mashreq's lending pipeline
sell-mashreq.detail: Mashreq receives the validated, FTA-compliant invoice data for financing assessment. Because the invoice has passed schema validation, business rules, and duplicate detection, Mashreq can underwrite with high confidence and reduced risk. The seller can access early payment while the buyer pays on standard terms. Clear submits the data package via Mashreq's Open Banking API.
sell-mashreq.dataFlow: Clear → Mashreq: Validated invoice + seller profile + dup check. Mashreq → Clear: Eligibility + terms.

sell-email.title: Email PDF Invoice with Payment Link
sell-email.subtitle: PDF invoice delivered directly with Visa payment options
sell-email.detail: In addition to Peppol delivery, Clear sends the buyer an email with a PDF invoice attachment. The PDF contains the full invoice details along with an embedded Visa QR code and a click-to-pay link -- making it easy for the buyer to pay directly from the document. This ensures the buyer receives the payment link even if their system hasn't ingested the Peppol message yet. For SMEs without sophisticated ERP systems, the PDF email is often the primary payment trigger.
sell-email.dataFlow: Clear → Buyer: Email with PDF invoice attachment (QR code + Visa payment link embedded in PDF). Includes payment due date and credit terms.

sell-remind.title: Payment Reminders
sell-remind.subtitle: Automated follow-ups based on credit terms
sell-remind.detail: Clear sends automated payment reminders to the buyer based on the invoice's payment due date and credit terms. Reminders escalate: a gentle nudge 7 days before due, a reminder on the due date, and follow-ups for overdue invoices. Each reminder includes the Visa payment link for one-click payment. Configurable frequency and escalation rules per seller.
sell-remind.dataFlow: Clear → Buyer: Scheduled email reminders with Visa payment link. Clear → Seller: Reminder status updates (sent, opened, clicked).

sell-callback.title: Payment Callback
sell-callback.subtitle: Real-time confirmation closes the loop
sell-callback.detail: When the buyer completes payment via Visa rails, Visa sends a real-time webhook to Clear with the transaction confirmation -- amount, transaction ID, timestamp, and settlement details. Clear instantly updates the invoice status to "Paid" and notifies the seller's ERP. The loop is fully closed: invoice created → payment link sent → payment received → seller notified, all tracked end-to-end.
sell-callback.dataFlow: Visa → Clear: Payment webhook (txn ID, amount, status, timestamp). Clear → Seller ERP: Real-time status update + settlement notification.

buy-receive.title: e-Invoice Received via Peppol
buy-receive.subtitle: A payment-enabled invoice reaches the buyer
buy-receive.detail: The inbound e-Invoice arrives from the seller's ASP on the Peppol network, carrying a Visa payment link. From Visa's perspective, this is the moment a payment-enabled invoice reaches the buyer -- every receipt is a potential Visa transaction. Clear, acting as the buyer's ASP, receives the signed SBDH envelope.
buy-receive.dataFlow: Seller ASP → Peppol → Clear (Buyer ASP): SBDH + PINT AE XML + payment link.

buy-validate.title: Multi-Layer Validation
buy-validate.subtitle: Protects Visa payment integrity and Mashreq financing quality
buy-validate.detail: Inbound validation ensures only legitimate, verified invoices reach the buyer's payment workflow -- protecting Visa's payment integrity and Mashreq's financing quality. Steps: (1) Peppol certificate verification -- is the sender a registered ASP? (2) Transport checks -- clean AS4 delivery? (3) XSD/XSLT conformance to PINT AE. (4) Duplicate detection. Clear's platform executes these checks; only passing invoices proceed.
buy-validate.dataFlow: Certificate → Transport → XSD/XSLT → Duplicate detection. Fail = reject with error codes.

buy-present.title: Invoice Presented to Buyer
buy-present.subtitle: Buyer sees invoice and Visa payment options simultaneously
buy-present.detail: The validated invoice is presented to the buyer via Clear's portal with prominent Visa payment options (QR code, click-to-pay link) and smart incentives (early payment discounts, EMI plans, bulk consolidation). This is the conversion point -- the buyer sees the invoice and payment options simultaneously, creating choice architecture that favors Visa capture. Clear handles the portal presentation and notification delivery.
buy-present.dataFlow: Clear → Buyer: Invoice presented via portal with Visa payment CTA + smart incentives. Buyer notified via email/SMS.

buy-qr.title: QR Code Payment
buy-qr.subtitle: Visa's mobile-first B2B payment path
buy-qr.detail: Visa's payment link generates a QR code the buyer can scan from mobile banking or Visa wallet. The QR encodes amount, merchant ID, and invoice reference for one-tap payment -- a frictionless path from invoice receipt to Visa transaction. This is Visa's mobile-first touchpoint in B2B payments.
buy-qr.dataFlow: Visa payment link → QR rendered in buyer view. Buyer scans → Payment via Visa network.

buy-link.title: Click-to-Pay Link
buy-link.subtitle: Visa's direct branded touchpoint with the buyer
buy-link.detail: Buyer clicks the embedded Visa payment link, opening Visa's secure payment page pre-filled with invoice details. 3DS authentication ensures payment security. This is Visa's direct branded touchpoint with the buyer -- secure, pre-filled, and linked to a verified invoice. Payment via Visa card or linked bank.
buy-link.dataFlow: Payment link URL → Visa secure page (pre-filled). Buyer authenticates (3DS) + pays.

buy-incentives.title: Smart Payment Incentives
buy-incentives.subtitle: Discounts, EMI, and bulk pay drive faster Visa transactions
buy-incentives.detail: Buyers are incentivized to pay faster and pay via Visa through three mechanisms: (1) Early payment discounts -- pay within 7 days for a 2% discount, automatically applied at checkout. (2) Bulk payment consolidation -- combine multiple outstanding invoices into a single Visa transaction, reducing payment friction. (3) EMI / installment plans -- split large invoices into monthly Visa payments, making high-value B2B transactions more accessible. Every incentive routes through Visa rails, increasing transaction volume and buyer engagement.
buy-incentives.dataFlow: Clear → Buyer: Incentive options presented alongside invoice. Buyer selects terms → Payment via Visa rails with applied discount/EMI schedule.

buy-execute.title: Payment via Visa Rails
buy-execute.subtitle: Visa captures B2B payment volume regardless of method
buy-execute.detail: Regardless of which payment method the buyer chose, the transaction routes through Visa rails. Visa captures the B2B payment volume. A confirmation webhook notifies the platform with status, transaction ID, and timestamp -- creating a verified invoice-to-payment link. This closed-loop data is valuable for both Visa analytics and Mashreq risk models.
buy-execute.dataFlow: Buyer → Visa: Payment. Visa → Clear: Webhook (status, txn ID, timestamp). Visa → Seller bank: Settlement.

buy-notify.title: Seller Notified + Status Updated
buy-notify.subtitle: Visa-powered closed-loop reconciliation
buy-notify.detail: Visa's payment confirmation triggers automatic reconciliation -- the invoice is marked "Paid" in both the seller's and buyer's systems. The loop is fully closed: a Visa-powered payment against an FTA-compliant invoice, with zero manual follow-up. Clear's platform handles the status update and seller notification in real-time.
buy-notify.dataFlow: Visa → Clear: Confirmation. Clear → Seller: Real-time notification. Both systems: Status = Paid.

alignmentCard.headline: Platform Alignment -- Clear
alignmentCard.body: Clear's incentives are fully aligned: higher ASP adoption grows Visa payment volume, validated invoice data feeds Mashreq's financing pipeline. Revenue scales with transaction throughput -- every Visa payment and Mashreq financing event benefits all three parties. Clear already operates as a dominant e-Invoicing platform in India (1M+ businesses), KSA, Malaysia, and the EU -- bringing battle-tested infrastructure and regulatory expertise to the UAE market.

tab6.headline: Security @ Scale
tab6.subheadline: Enterprise-grade payment security, proven global footprint, and UAE data sovereignty.
tab6.footprintHeadline: Proven at Scale -- Clear's Global e-Invoicing Footprint
tab6.footprintSubheadline: Clear is not building e-Invoicing for the first time in UAE. The platform already processes millions of invoices across multiple regions across the globe, bringing battle-tested infrastructure and deep compliance expertise.
